item.title: Pytorch C++ Front
item.description: Sometimes we need an efficiency, low latency enviroment to run our model. Also, most of the embedded system is written in C/C++, the C++ front can makeC++ developers directly use C++ to build their pytorch model as well. You could reference the official installing guide to build the example. The design of the C++ front-end follow the following rules: Closely model the Python frontend in its design:

item.title: Pytorch Front CMake
item.description: Error CUDA_cublas_LIBRARY-NOTFOUND It is that camke can not find cuda, it seems that someone also get this error when using CUDA10. !(https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54347530/how-to-link-cublas-library-with-cmake-cuda-10-0-ubuntu-18) cmake ssl problem sudo apt install libssl-dev
